page.title: 04CLUBS
page.content: The present green was laid in 1931, and leased from a Mr. Doubleday until 1938 when it was sold to the club at a sum of Â£1.00 per member.The four rink green has been extended this season by fifty per cent ,although the two new rinks will not be playable until 1986. The club is affilliated to the Grantham and District bowls Association and compete against fifteen other teams in a league. Friendly matches are also played against teams from a wide area stretching from as far North as Newark,to Rhyall and Cottesmore in the South. Inter club competitions are held to determine singles,doubles and triples champions annually.Younger people are now taking up the sport, disproving the saying that 'Bowls is an old man's game! The oldest member of the club is 78,the youngest is 14.
